there's also this open PR by Seth

text: This paper has a proper derivation of the formula <https://arxiv.org/abs/1909.02659>, for complex numbers, there is an additional term due to the gauge problem.

attachments.title: Automatic Differentiation for Complex Valued SVD
attachments.text: In this note, we report the back propagation formula for complex valued singular value decompositions (SVD). This formula is an important ingredient for a complete automatic differentiation(AD)...
attachments.fallback: arXiv.org: Automatic Differentiation for Complex Valued SVD

elements.text: This paper has a proper derivation of the formula
, for complex numbers, there is an additional term due to the gauge problem.

text: <@U6A936746> as far as I could tell that paper only covers pulling back the cotangent of the leading eigenvector.

elements.text: as far as I could tell that paper only covers pulling back the cotangent of the leading eigenvector.

text:
In SumProductTransform, we have been representing Dense matrices directly form SVD, such that we can efficiently calculate logabsdet and inverse.  The implementation requires differentiable parametrization of Orthonormal matrices from here
<https://github.com/pevnak/Unitary.jl>
with the implementation of what mimics Dense layer from Flux here
<https://github.com/pevnak/SumProductTransform.jl/blob/master/src/layers/svddense.jl>

with the implementation of what mimics Dense layer from Flux here

text: It does not use diffrules, but ZygoteRules, but it can be fixed easily
